titles.title: Statutory Time-Periods Technical Amendments Act of 2009
A bill to make technical amendments to laws containing time periods affecting judicial proceedings.
Statutory Time-Periods Technical Amendments Act of 2009

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: Statutory Time-Periods Technical Amendments Act of 2009 - Amends federal bankruptcy, criminal, and civil law, as well as the Classified Information Procedures Act and the Controlled Substances Act, to extend from 5 to 7 days, and from 10 to 14 days, counting holidays and weekends, specified deadlines affecting court proceedings to harmonize them with recent amendments to the federal time-computation rules intended to provide predictability and uniformity to the current process of calculating court deadlines.
